intro: Ardisia prionata, commonly known as the slender arrowwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, berry-like fruits. Ardisia prionata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal flowering.
